source.e2cd9daa: %%html
source.4ae128fe: **How to use the dashboard:** 1. A line on each graph represents information from a date 2. X axis in all line graphs represents the hour of the day 3. Inverter ID is the source key from the plant table 4. Clicking on a line will highlight that data point in all the graphs 5. Filter icon displays a day level scatter plot between - Sum(AC Power) vs Avg(Ambient Tembrature) 6. You can use the scatter plot to filter the highlight the lines on the other graphs, it will help in understanding instances like high temprature **Note:** Use the dashboard in desktop mode, full screen for better. You can go to this link to view the dashboard better
source.63bd2a3e:
**Aggregation present at hour level:**
* Max of Daily Yield per hour
* Sum of AC Power/ DC Power per hour
* Average of Ambient and Module Temprature
* Sum of irradiation
source.4ee73d1c:
### Objective
To see the hourly variation of power generated and temprature across dates per inverter
source.ce3bc1f5: # Hourly Variation of Data across days
